sessions.title: Summary: The attacks on Minnesota legislators and their families continue a trend of political violence that has targeted lawmakers in both parties. Coarsened political discourse has contributed to a culture of distrust and cynicism. Join national experts and legislative leaders to explore what lawmakers, legislative staff and others can do to turn down the temperature and restore civility in the public square.

Coarsened political discourse has contributed to a culture of distrust and cynicism. Join national experts and legislative leaders to explore what lawmakers, legislative staff and others can do to turn down the temperature and restore civility in the public square.

sessions.title: Summary: Fifty years ago, there were three competing organizations of state legislators and staff. After five years of negotiations, three became one—the National Conference of State Legislatures. Join us to hear stories about NCSL’s early years from those who were there.
sessions.description: Fifty years ago, there were three competing organizations of state legislators and staff. After five years of negotiations, three became one—the National Conference of State Legislatures. Join us to hear stories about NCSL’s early years from those who were there.

sessions.title: Summary: States have assessed government effectiveness for decades via legislative oversight. This year, the creation of the federal Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) sparked a renewed emphasis in some states. Join us to learn new and improved ways state legislatures are holding agencies accountable, ensuring state programs are operating as intended.

Come explore key legislative developments from statehouses nationwide, insights into the policy implications of the new administration's priorities, and other emerging health policy topics.

Discover how world trade dynamics are evolving and the impact on states of an increasingly complex global market.

Come hear experts share federal, state and private sector strategies for reducing fraud, protecting consumers and exposing and prosecuting those responsible.

Come learn about different approaches to regulating foreign involvement in state politics and see how your state compares.

sessions.title: Summary: In this popular program on “finding an extra hour” every day, Randy Dean, “The E-mail Sanity Expert”®, uses humor and high energy as he covers many of the most common areas of productivity loss afflicting many busy professionals: e-mail and input overload, managing multiple projects/tasks, unexpected interruptions, mental and physical “clutter”, and better managing your time, people, and projects. This includes specific strategies for Microsoft and Google users so they can apply these strategies to the software they use every day. helping stressed performers find extra time, leading to (hopefully!) an extra hour of productivity and focus every day.

sessions.title: Summary: Habitual super-speeders—those who regularly go more than 25 mph over the limit—are more prevalent than ever on American roadways, and more than 12,000 deaths occur each year in speeding-related traffic crashes. Learn how states can harness enforcement, technology and infrastructure strategies to curtail speeding and protect other road users.

sessions.title: Summary: Join us pier-side for this exclusive event at the historic Charlestown Navy Yard, beside the USS Constitution, the world’s oldest commissioned naval warship still afloat. Enjoy a summer evening with historical reenactments, a fife and drum presentation, and great food and drinks on Boston Harbor. Please note: Shuttles will run from BCEC to the USS Constitution from 5-6 p.m. Shuttles will not run between hotels and the USS Constitution. Return shuttles will not be available. Board the USS Constitution | 5:30-8:30 p.m. Board the world’s oldest commissioned warship still afloat, a rare chance to step onto a piece of living history from the War of 1812. Nicknamed "Old Ironsides" for its strong oak hull that repelled British cannon fire, the ship now serves as an active-duty Navy vessel, stationed at the Charlestown Navy Yard in Boston. The experience brings to life over 200 years of naval heritage while offering stunning views of Boston Harbor. A tour not to be missed! Board the Cassin Young at the Charlestown Navy Yard | 5:30-7:30 p.m. The USS Cassin Young (DD-793) is a Fletcher-class destroyer of the U.S. Navy named for Captain Cassin Young (1894-1942) who was awarded the Medal of Honor for his heroism at the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and killed in the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal in the fall of 1942. The destroyer was launched Sept. 12, 1943, and was designated a National Historic Landmark in 1986 as one of only four surviving Fletcher-class destroyers still afloat. In addition to the tour, a representative from the National Park Service Engagement with National Park Service rangers will talk about the history of the National Park.

sessions.title: Summary: This session provides state legislators with an in-depth exploration of the changing landscape of American federalism and the critical role states play in influencing national policy. Participants will examine the constitutional foundations of federalism, navigate current intergovernmental challenges, and explore strategies for asserting state authority in key areas such as health care, education, infrastructure and more. Through interactive discussions legislators will gain valuable insights into how states can both collaborate with and push back against the federal government to safeguard local priorities and strengthen democratic governance. Attendees will leave with a clearer understanding of their constitutional responsibilities and practical approaches to exercising state power in today’s complex federal system.

sessions.title: Summary: As global economic uncertainty challenges trade and economic stability, this session offers a unique opportunity to explore how representatives from Canada, the European Union, and Massachusetts are addressing these issues. Through a combination of brief, insightful presentations and collaborative group activities, attendees will dive into the trade strategies, challenges, and opportunities shaping global partnerships. Following opening remarks from each speaker, participants will work in small groups to tackle real-world trade challenges, brainstorm actionable solutions, and explore opportunities for deeper collaboration between U.S. states and international partners. Groups will then share their findings in a facilitated debrief, with speakers reflecting on the proposed solutions and providing additional insights.

sessions.title: Summary: From missing persons and car theft to traffic enforcement and tolling, license plates and new camera technology help ensure public safety. Learn how states are using these tools and addressing new concerns.

sessions.title: Summary: Massachusetts has long been regarded as having among the best education systems in the world. Come learn about the policies and practices in place to achieve such success and how the state plans to address the challenges that lie ahead.

sessions.title: Summary: Drug overdose deaths have surged fivefold in the last 25 years, claiming over a million U.S. lives. But in in 2023, overdose deaths fell for the first time in five years. Join experts and state legislative leaders as they reflect on the policies that might be fueling this turnaround and explore policy options to meet the challenges moving forward.

sessions.title: Summary: Join us for a quick update on the latest federal developments in technology-related legislation focused on emerging issues such as artificial intelligence, privacy, cybersecurity, fintech and broadband. Gain an understanding of how federal tech policy is shaping the future and what actions states can take to stay ahead of the curve.

sessions.title: Summary: Join the Food Ingredient Safety Coalition (FISC) in a session exploring why food safety should remain a federal responsibility. Presenters will outline how a consistent, science-based system protects consumers, avoids costly state patchworks, and ensures access to safe, affordable food nationwide, including in schools. Learning Hubs are 30-minute informational sessions held in the Exhibit Hall. The content presented at these sponsored discussions is at the sole discretion of exhibitors. NCSL does not endorse the content. For more information, visit https://www.ncsl.org/summit/learning-hub.

sessions.title: Summary: Make your state’s voice heard. All legislators and legislative staff are encouraged to attend the annual NCSL Business Meeting, which will consider policy directives and resolutions that will guide NCSL's advocacy efforts before Congress and the administration, elect NCSL officers and Executive Committee members, consider amendments to NCSL's Bylaws and Rules of Procedures, and approve the NCSL budget. All Summit attendees are welcome to observe. Parliamentarians: Tom Bottern, Secretary of the Minnesota Senate and Jennifer Novack, Secretary of the Idaho Senate.

sessions.title: Summary: You’re going to want to be in the room where it happens—the Legislative Summit’s closing general session where Tony and Grammy award winner Leslie Odom, Jr. will perform and inspire. On the eve of reprising his iconic role of Aaron Burr on Broadway, Odom will bring his life lessons on following your passions, discovering your own potential, and surrounding yourself with the right people. And he just might perform a few of his iconic songs, too. Don’t throw away your shot—join us for this spectacular closing general session.

sessions.title: Summary: Wrap up the NCSL Legislative Summit at Leader Bank Pavilion on Boston Harbor with a performance by the iconic Boston Pops and legendary R&B group Boyz II Men. Enjoy an evening under a tent with food, drinks and live music, along with an unforgettable view of Boston Harbor at sunset. This is an event you won’t want to miss! Please note there will be a fireworks display following the concert. Presented by Live Nation.
